title: Georgia’s 6-Week Abortion Ban Begins Immediately After Court Ruling
description: A federal appeals court said the law, which was signed in 2019 but quickly halted for violating Roe v. Wade, could go into effect.

title: Giuliani Ordered to Testify in Georgia Criminal Investigation
description: After Rudolph W. Giuliani failed to show for a hearing in Manhattan, a Georgia judge ordered him to testify as part of an investigation into election interference in the state.

title: Uvalde Superintendent Recommends Firing School Police Chief
description: Chief Pete Arredondo has been criticized for a delay of more than an hour in entering the classroom where a gunman had fatally wounded 19 students and two teachers.

title: New Findings Detail Trump Plan to Use Census for Partisan Gain
description: A new trove of memos and emails suggests that the plan to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census aimed to cause an undercount that would favor Republicans.

title: After Another Mass Shooting, Questions Loom About the Role of Parents
description: Mothers and fathers of young men accused in shootings, including the 21-year-old charged in the massacre in Highland Park, Ill., have faced scrutiny.

title: Uvalde Teacher Recounts Harrowing Assault Inside Classroom
description: A teacher who survived the mass shooting recounts the harrowing attack and desperate wait for a rescue.

title: Protesters at White House Call on Biden to Protect Abortion Rights
description: The rally on Saturday, in which some demonstrators risked arrest, reflected activists’ growing frustration with the administration.

title: Sexual Abuse of Teens in the Military’s J.R.O.T.C. Program
description: Former students say military veterans who led J.R.O.T.C. classes in U.S. high schools fashioned themselves as mentors, then used their power to manipulate and abuse.

title: 2 Are Indicted in Human Smuggling Case That Left 53 Dead in Texas
description: Two men from Texas could face the death penalty after a tractor-trailer carrying dead migrants was found on the outskirts of San Antonio last month.

title: He Built a Home to Survive a Civil War. Tragedy Found Him Anyway.
description: C. Wesley Morgan once believed that the place he built, which included a 2,000-square-foot bunker, was the safest house in Kentucky.

title: Stacey Abrams Aims to Put Abortion at Center of Georgia Governor Race
description: After a court ruling put the state’s six-week abortion ban back into effect, Ms. Abrams said that while economic struggles would come and go, “this law is permanent.”

title: Biden Is Experiencing Mild Symptoms After Testing Positive
description: The diagnosis raises health concerns for the president and is a vivid reminder that the virus remains a threat.

title: Do Californians Want Mask Mandates to Come Back?
description: Readers tell us.

title: New Reading Curriculum Is Mired in Debate Over Race and Gender
description: Lucy Calkins’s curriculum was meant to bring phonics to struggling students. But its publication has been stalled after a debate over whether to accommodate conservative state laws.

title: Liz Cheney, Front and Center in the Jan. 6 Hearings, Pursues a Mission
description: “I believe this is the most important thing I’ve ever done professionally,” she said, “and maybe the most important thing I ever do.”

title: Jan. 6 Panel to Sum Up Its Case Against Trump: Dereliction of Duty
description: In a hearing aimed at putting a capstone on the public sessions thus far, two military veterans will make the case that Mr. Trump neglected his presidential duties when he refused to call off the mob.

title: How to Watch the Next Jan. 6 Hearing in Prime Time
description: The session will be held on Thursday in prime time, and will focus on former President Donald J. Trump’s inaction on the day of the riot.

title: Biden Administration Is Elevating an H.H.S. Division to Oversee Pandemic Responses
description: The move effectively creates a new federal agency — on par with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Lightning Kills One Soldier and Injures 9 Others at Georgia Army Base
description: The episode happened in a training area at Fort Gordon at a time when there were strong thunderstorms in the area.

title: Fetterman Hopes to Return to Senate Campaign Trail Soon, He Says in New Interview
description: After a stroke in May, Lt. Gov. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania, the state’s Democratic Senate nominee, is slowly re-emerging in public. His first interview since then was with a Pittsburgh paper.

title: Same-Sex Marriage Bill, Considered Dead on Arrival, Gains New Life
description: The larger-than-expected G.O.P. vote in the House in support of legislation to codify marriage equality caught both parties off guard, suggesting there could be a narrow path to enactment.

title: Prosecutors Rest in Contempt Case Against Steve Bannon
description: The government, seeking to hold Mr. Bannon to account for defying a subpoena from Congress, wrapped up its case after calling just two witnesses.

title: Democrats’ Dilemma on Manchin: Bash Him, or Bash Big Oil Instead?
description: With his climate agenda in ruins, President Biden faces a stark political choice, liberal pundits say.

title: Trump Urged Legislator to Overturn His 2020 Defeat in Wisconsin
description: Donald J. Trump called Robin Vos, the speaker of the Wisconsin Assembly, on July 9 and pushed him to support a resolution to retract the state’s 10 electoral votes for President Biden.

title: Survey Looks at Acceptance of Political Violence in U.S.
description: Nearly 12 percent of respondents said it was at least “sometimes justified” to use violence if it meant returning Donald J. Trump to the presidency.

title: Biden Announces Plans to Deal With Climate ‘Emergency’
description: The president stopped short of declaring a national emergency and instead announced several steps aimed at dealing with the effects of climate change.

title: How Dan Cox Won the Republican Race for Maryland Governor
description: Dan Cox, the new Republican nominee for governor, won by playing up his right-wing credentials — which Democrats eagerly emphasized in television advertising.

title: Driver Hits Family in Montana and Opens Fire, Killing Father and Toddler
description: David Siau and his 18-month-old daughter, McKenzie, were killed when Derick Amos Madden rammed his vehicle into the family in East Glacier Park, Mont., and shot at them, the authorities said.

title: American Bridge Sues the F.E.C. Over Trump’s 2024 Hinting
description: American Bridge claims in a lawsuit that the F.E.C.’s inaction has given Donald J. Trump an unlawful advantage over any Democratic opponent in 2024.

title: Woman Posing as Nurse Tried to Steal Baby From Hospital, Authorities Say
description: Jesenea Miron is accused of entering a hospital in Moreno Valley, Calif., “posing as a newly hired nurse” and trying to take a newborn from a patient’s room.

title: Bipartisan Senate Group Strikes Deal to Rewrite Electoral Count Act
description: The changes outlined by the senators are intended to prevent a repeat of the effort on Jan. 6, 2021, to overturn the presidential election in Congress.

title: Delay as the New Denial: The Latest Republican Tactic to Block Climate Action
description: The party has largely moved beyond denying the existence of climate change but continues to oppose dramatic action to halt it, worried about the short-term economic consequences.

title: Texas Lakes Are Drying Up Amid the Heat and Drought
description: Says one tackle shop owner in Texas: “We’ve got $5-a-gallon gasoline and border issues, but low water is our biggest problem.”
